tool.name: calplot
tool.description: {\tt calplot} is a plotting tool for calibration tables of all types (B=bandpass, G=gain, D=instrumental polarization, P=parallactic angle, T=troposphere, M=baseline-based gain, MF=baseline-based bandpass, and K=fringe fitting). The default plot style is single-panel, but if an iteration axis is specified, multi-panel plots are supported. Zooming and region-based flagging is possible on single and multi panel plots.

method.name: calplot
method.example: # create a calplot tool cp := calplot();

method.name: next
method.description: Continue plotting by stepping through the iteration axes.

method.name: open
method.shortdescription:
*** 
 Open a calibration table for use. 
 Supported calibration types: 
 G = gain
 B = bandpass
 M = baseline-based gain
 MF= baseline-based bandpass
 P = parallactic angle
 T = troposphere
 K = baseline-based fringe fitting
 ***
method.description: Open a calibration table for use.

param.name: caltable
param.description: Calibration Table name

method.name: plot
method.shortdescription:
*** 
 Plot calibration solutions using user inputs from plotoptions, setdata 
 Options: plottype - AMP, PHASE, REAL, IMAG, SNR
 ***
method.description: Draw plots specified via user inputs. If multiplot is turned on and an iteration axis is selected, the {\tt next} method can be used to step through the data. specification of the what of the calibration solution to plot is necessary, default is PHASE. Supported solution type (AMP, PHASE, RLPHASE, XYPHASE, DELAY, DELAYRATE, DISPDELAY)

param.name: xaxis
param.description: Value to plot on the X axis ("time","chan","amp","phase","real","imag","snr")

param.name: yaxis
param.description: Value to plot on the Y axis ("amp","phase","real","imag","snr")

method.example: # plot some phase calibration solution cp.open('caldata.gcal') cp.plot("PHASE")

method.name: savefig
method.description:
Store the contents of the plot window in a file. The file format (type) is based on the file name, ie. the file extension given determines the format the file is saved as. The accepted formats are eps, ps, png, pdf, and svg.
Internally, this function uses the matplotlib pl.savefig function.
Note that if a full path is not given that the files will be saved in the current working directory.

param.name: filename
param.description: Name the plot image is to be saved to.

param.name: dpi
param.description: Number of dots per inch (resolution) to save the image at.

param.name: orientation
param.description: Either landscape or portrait. Supported by the postscript format only.

param.name: papertype
param.description: Valid values are: letter, legal, exective, ledger, a0-a10 and b0-b10. This option is supported byt the postscript format only.

param.name: facecolor
param.description: Color of space between the plot and the edge of the square. Valid values are the same as those accepted by the plotcolor option.

param.name: edgecolor
param.description: Color of the outer edge. Valid values are the same as those accepted by the plotcolor option.

method.name: plotoptions
method.shortdescription:
*** 
 Specify list of plot options. 
 Options: multiplot = true; will use the nxpanels,nypanels setting for display
***
method.description: Specify a list of plot options including number of panels in x and y, iteration axis (if any), and if it is a multiplot.

param.name: subplot
param.description: matplotlib style panel number, e.g 221 means 4 panels 2x2 and plotting on the first panel

param.name: overplot
param.description: Overplot the next plot.

param.name: iteration
param.description: Iterate plots on antenna, spw, field, and/or time

param.name: plotrange
param.description: integer for the plot symbol.

param.name: showflags
param.description: Create multiple pages of plots (per antenna).

param.name: plotsymbol
param.description: The plot symbol to use

param.name: plotcolor
param.description: integer for the plot symbol.

param.name: markersize
param.description: integer for the plot symbol.

param.name: fontsize
param.description: integer for the plot symbol.

method.name: markflags
method.shortdescription: *** \n Mark a rectangular region to flag. Click left mouse button, drag and release to mark the region. Multiple regions can be marked. Hit ESC to clearregions (not currently enabled).\n ***
method.description: This function is to be called every time a box is to be drawn to flag data

param.name: panel
param.description: whihc panel to flag on, in case there is more than 1

param.name: region
param.description: [xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax] bounding box

method.example: # plot some calibration solution and do some flagging cp.open('caldata.gcal') cp.plot() cp.markflags() cp.flagdata()

method.name: flagdata
method.shortdescription: *** \n Flag Data for selected flag regions. Flags are not writtento disk unless diskwrite=true (or diskwrite=1) is set.\n ***
method.description: Mark the solutions that has been marked by previous calls of markflags as bad in the caltable.

method.name: locatedata
method.shortdescription: *** \n Locate and print info about Data for selected flag regions.\n ***
method.description: Display information about the solutions that has been marked by previous calls of markflags.

method.name: selectcal
method.shortdescription: *** \n Select a subset of the data for plotting and specify calibration type \n ***
method.description: This method enables plotting of a subset of the caltable.

param.name: antenna
param.description: Select on antennas

param.name: field
param.description: Select on field

param.name: spw
param.description: Select on spectral window

param.name: time
param.description: Select on time

param.name: poln
param.description: Polarization to plot ("", "RL", "R", "L", "XY", "X", "Y", "/")

method.name: stopiter
method.description: To be called at the end of the plot iterations, or in between if desired.

param.name: rmplotter
param.description: Indicates of the plot window should be removed (true)from the display or left (false)

method.name: clearplot
method.shortdescription: Clear the plotting window or a particular panel.
method.description: Clear the plotting window. Either clear the whole window (default) or a particular panel (specified by the subplot parameter). \n ***

param.name: subplot
param.description: Three digits number: first digit for nrows, second for ncols, last for pannel number.
